article:
A teacher shows three toys to a student .Then she asks the student to find out the   _  . All the three toys seem to be   _   in their shape, size and material. After careful   _  , the student sees holes in the toys. The first toy has holes in the   _  . The second has holes in one ear and mouth. And the third has only one hole in one ear. 
    Then with the   _   of a needle, which is put into the holes in one of the ears of the three toys, the student realizes the   _  of the company of the people who are   _  . 
   The first toy represents those people around you who give a(n)   _  that they are listening to you ,all your things and   care for  you. But they just   _  to do so. After listening,   _  the needle would come out from the other ear of the first toy, the things you said to them are   _  . So be   _  while you are speaking to this type of people around you, who   _  care for you. 
    The second toy represents those people who listen to you and all your things and it seems that you   _  a lot to them. But as in the second toy, the needle would come out from the mouth. These people will   give away  your things and the words you tell them.
    The needle would not come out in the third toy, which represents those people who will keep the   _  you have in them. They are the ones who you can   count on  .
    People, who   listen to  what you tell them, are not   _  the ones you can count on when you need them the most.
